# Introduction
## Are urban columbidae communities strutured by habitat filtering or via competitive interactions?

- With competitive interactions we expect the phylogenetic and functional distance between species to higher than expected than within a random community.
- With habitat filtering we expect the phylogentic and functional distance between species to be lower than expected than within a random community.

@Swenson2007; @CavenderBares2009

## Recommended community metrics 

- Functional diversity of all traits @PetcheyAndGaston2002
- Convex Hull Volume (CHV) of all traits (a multivariate measure of the range of community values) @Cornwall2006
- Mean taxon distance (MTD)  is mean pairwise phylogenetic distances between co-occurring species and is most sensitive to tree-wide patterns of phylogenetic clustering and evenness.
- Mean nearest taxon distance (MNTD) is mean pairwise phylogenetic distances separating each species from its closest co-occurring relative and is most sensitive to phylogenetic clustering or evenness at the tips of phylogeny.
- FD of each trait individually 
- Variance of each trait within community previously used to measure trait clustering
- SDNDr (standard deviation of distances between neighbouring species along a single trait axis, divided by the trait range of the community) is used to detect the regular spacing in species trait values predicted by competitive exclusion.

@Trisos2014

## Recommended null model 
Many metrics sensitive to species richness. Urban communities are governed by the surrounding regional pool. For each urban community, we can generate all of the possible communities with the same species richness as the urban community with species from the regional pool.  The average of all possible communities gives us a null model.
@Miller2017

# Create community matrix
```{r}
to_species_matrix_with_relative_abundance = function(valid_city_ids) {
  c = communities[communities$city_id %in% valid_city_ids, c('city_id', 'ebird_species_name', 'relative_abundance_proxy')]
  c$ebird_species_name = str_replace(c$ebird_species_name, ' ', '_')
  m = pivot_wider(c[, c('ebird_species_name', 'relative_abundance_proxy', 'city_id')], names_from = ebird_species_name, values_from = "relative_abundance_proxy", values_fill = list(relative_abundance_proxy = as.double(0.0)))
  tibble::column_to_rownames(m, var='city_id')
}
```

# Create functions for generating community metrics

## MNTD
Calculate MNTD for each community using @Kembel2010
```{r}
get_mntd_for_communities = function(communities, phydist_urban_columbidae = cophenetic(columbidae_tree)) {
  urban_community_mntd_result = mntd(as.matrix(communities), phydist_urban_columbidae, abundance.weighted=TRUE)
  data.frame(site = rownames(communities), mntd = urban_community_mntd_result)
}
```

## Function to create all metrics
```{r get_community_metrics}
get_community_metrics = function(communities, included_traits_for_single_trait_metrics = analysis_single_traits) {

  result = get_mntd_for_communities(communities)
  
  for (trait in included_traits_for_single_trait_metrics) {
    fd_col_name = function(value) {
      paste(trait, 'fdiv', sep = '_')
    }
  
    fd_single_trait = get_fd_for_traits(trait, communities) %>%
      dplyr::select('site', 'FDiv') %>%
      rename_with(fd_col_name, 'FDiv')
    
    result = right_join(result, fd_single_trait)
  }
  
  result
}
```

Our null model is every possible community of species from the regional pool with the same richness as the urban pool


Create function to generate every combination of values from a vector.
```{r}
combinations = function(v) {
  if (length(v) == 2) {
    data.frame(x = c(v[1], v[2]), y = c(v[2],v[1])) 
  } else {
    foreach(i = 1:length(v), .combine = 'rbind') %do% {
      left = v[i]
      right = v[-i]
      cbind(left, combinations(right))
    }
  }
}

combinations(c(1, 2, 3))
combinations(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6))
combinations(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7))
```

```{r}
POPULATION_SAMPLE_SIZE = 5040
REGIONAL_POOL_SIZE_FOR_MAX_POP = 7

to_possible_populations = function(proxy_relative_abundance_values) {
  new_cols = paste('Var', 1:length(proxy_relative_abundance_values), sep='')
    
  if (length(proxy_relative_abundance_values) <= REGIONAL_POOL_SIZE_FOR_MAX_POP) {
    all_pops = unique(combinations(proxy_relative_abundance_values))
    colnames(all_pops) = new_cols
    all_pops
  } else {
    # include actual population as first row
    sample_pops = rbind(proxy_relative_abundance_values, data.frame())
    
    attempts = 0
    
    repeat {
      sample_pops = unique(rbind(sample(proxy_relative_abundance_values), sample_pops))
      attempts = attempts + 1
      
      if (nrow(sample_pops) >= POPULATION_SAMPLE_SIZE) {
        break;
      }
      
      if (attempts > (2 * POPULATION_SAMPLE_SIZE)) {
        print(paste('Failed to find', POPULATION_SAMPLE_SIZE, 'samples, only found', nrow(sample_pops), sep = ' '))
        break;
      }
    }
    
    colnames(sample_pops) = new_cols
    sample_pops
  }
}

to_possible_populations(communities$relative_abundance_proxy[communities$city_id == test_city_id])
```

```{r}
to_all_equal_abundance_communities = function(urban_richness, regional_richness) {
  null_model_sites = expand.grid(rep(list(TRUE:FALSE), regional_richness))
  null_model_sites_species_richness =  data.frame(species_richness = pmap_dbl(null_model_sites, sum))
  null_model_sites = cbind(null_model_sites, null_model_sites_species_richness)
  null_model_sites[null_model_sites$species_richness == urban_richness, 1:regional_richness]
}

to_all_equal_abundance_communities(2, 3)
```

Function to build every possible community from the species in the regional pool and the given relative abundances
```{r}
create_null_model_communities = function(city_id, urban_richness, regional_species, proxy_relative_abundance_values) {
  regional_richness = length(regional_species)
  urban_richness = length(proxy_relative_abundance_values[proxy_relative_abundance_values > 0])
  actual_total_relative_abundance = sum(proxy_relative_abundance_values)
  
  null_model_sites = rbind(
    to_all_equal_abundance_communities(urban_richness, regional_richness),
    to_possible_populations(proxy_relative_abundance_values)
  )
  
  regional_species = str_replace(regional_species, ' ', '_')
  
  colnames(null_model_sites) = regional_species
  rownames(null_model_sites) = 1:nrow(null_model_sites)
  
  null_model_sites[,regional_species]
}

test_null_model = create_null_model_communities(
  test_city_id, 
  community_summary$urban_pool_size[community_summary$city_id == test_city_id], 
  communities$ebird_species_name[communities$city_id == test_city_id],
  communities$relative_abundance_proxy[communities$city_id == test_city_id]
)

test_null_model
```

# Compare Urban Communities to regional null models
```{r}
standardise(1.5, 1, 2)
```

Create function to test actual value against all possible null model values
```{r}
compare_community_to_null_model = function(metric_name, actual_metric_value, null_model_metric_values) {
  mean_value = mean(null_model_metric_values)
  sd_value = sd(null_model_metric_values)
  
  result = data.frame(
    standard = standardise(actual_metric_value, mean_value, sd_value),
    actual = actual_metric_value
  )
  
  col_name = function(value) {
      paste(metric_name, value, sep = '_')
  }
  
  colnames(result) = c(col_name('standard'), col_name('actual'))
  result
}
```


```{r}
compare_community_to_null_model('mass_fdiv', 0.7167711, test_null_model_community_metrics$mass_fdiv)
```

```{r}
all_metrics_to_test = colnames(test_community_metrics)[-1]
```

Compare the actual values to the null model values:
```{r}
create_null_model_test_values = function(city_id, urban_richness, regional_species, relative_abundance_proxy_values, actual_values) {
  null_models = create_null_model_communities(city_id, urban_richness, regional_species, relative_abundance_proxy_values)
  null_model_community_values = get_community_metrics(null_models)
  
  foreach(metric = all_metrics_to_test, .combine = 'cbind') %do% {
      compare_community_to_null_model(metric, actual_values[,c(metric)], null_model_community_values[,c(metric)])
  } %>% mutate(city_id = city_id)
}

create_null_model_test_values(
  test_city_id, 
  community_summary$urban_pool_size[community_summary$city_id == test_city_id], 
  communities$ebird_species_name[communities$city_id == test_city_id],
  communities$relative_abundance_proxy[communities$city_id == test_city_id],
  test_community_metrics[test_community_metrics$site == test_city_id,]
)
```
